meanings.definition: To manufacture or produce in advance.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to premanufacture the new product to ensure it would be ready for the launch.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice in the industry to premanufacture goods to meet demand efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The chef premanufactured the cake batter, so all he had to do was bake it when the customers arrived.
meanings.sent4: She premanufactured her speech in her mind, rehearsing it over and over before the big presentation.
meanings.sent5: The artist premanufactured sketches of the sculpture before starting the actual construction.

meanings.definition: The process of manufacturing or producing something before it is needed.
meanings.sent1: Premanufacture allows companies to have products ready for customers without delays.
meanings.sent2: The premanufacture of components helped streamline the assembly process.
meanings.sent3: The early premanufacture of the toys ensured they would be available for the holiday season.
meanings.sent4: The premanufacture of the costumes saved time for the theater production.
meanings.sent5: The premanufacture of the parts reduced the overall production time of the machinery.
